data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes the opposite direction to return to the starting point and it never takes backwards either. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
While holding your arms straight out in front of you, you take 4 steps and turn around. You pass the starting point if you make the same move right after this. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you turn around, you need to take six steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As long as you keep one step from making your own way, if you start from that point and repeat, you will end up back at that place. If you complete this same sequence, you can take 5 steps back to start at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left is the first step after turning left. Turning right is the next step after turning right. Steps to the left, right, and up are the same as steps to the right. So, the answer isn't Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around. Take 7 steps and then turn around again. Turn around. Take 7 steps and then take another 7 steps. Turn left. Turn right. So, the answer is No.

Turn left. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. If you turn right, the direction changes to right. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps to return to the starting point. Take 6 steps back.

You will always take 1 step left or left if you are facing forward. If you turn your face right, you will always face forward. So, the answer is No.

If you took 3 steps, it would not take 9 steps to get to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

You always face forward. If you start forward you backward only. Returning backward does not take one step. So, the answer is no.

You start at point A and move forward to the right. Point A is made to face right and Point B is made to face left. Point A makes you start in straight line and point B makes you move down. So, the answer is No.

There are 9 steps left and 10 steps left in the first step to bring you to the starting point. There are 3 steps left, 1 step left and 6 steps left in the first step to return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

A person always faces forward. A person always takes 7 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right leads to turning around, just as turning right leads to turning around. If you take five steps to turn around in place, you return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

The first instructions would not allow you to go backward while facing forward. These instructions did not allow us to go backward. In order to return backward you must go forward. So, the answer is No.

A person always takes one step backward. The number of steps you take are the ones that make the direction you choose. If you are always facing forward, the number of steps are the same regardless of the direction you are facing. If you are always facing forward, the number of steps backward are the ones that turn the direction you are going in. Clearly the starting point is to the right of the start. If you go 4 steps forward you go 4 steps to the left. A positive number can be found by finding both 4 and 6.
